required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Stanford Cardiac Invasive Electrophysiology Novel Computer Experience
clinical_study.official_title: Stanford Cardiac Invasive Electrophysiology Novel Computer Experience (SCIENCE)

brief_summary.textblock: This study will test the ability of computer algorithms to predict successful ablation therapy for atrial arrhythmias.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients will be recruited prospectively from among those undergoing ablation for atrial fibrillation (AF) or atrial tachycardias (AT) which may be reentrant or focal. Each patient will undergo careful data collection, including electrogram data and sites of ablation lesions. Ablation will proceed in operator-dependent fashion, and will not be modified in any way for this study. The research question is whether algorithms based on data such as electrograms and details of the ablation performed can predict which patients will have a successful case. Primary endpoints are measures of clinical success defined by (a) acute termination of atrial arrhythmia during the case; (b) long-term reduction in arrhythmia burden; (c) long-term freedom from arrhythmia. Secondary endpoints include (a) identification of sites of arrhythmia termination; (b) improved clinical status.

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in AF burden on follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Reduction in amount of arrhythmia per unit time, compared to prior to the procedure.
Absence of arrhythmia, defined by clinical thresholds.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical status as measured by the EQ5D
secondary_outcome.description: Patient feeling better subjectively in EQ5D

other_outcome.description: Documentation of whether ablation acutely eliminated atrial fibrillation

arm_group.description: No study intervention. Patients referred for ablation of atrial arrhythmias will be treated as per operator preference with no study intervention. Data will be collected in de-identified fashion.

intervention.intervention_name: No Intervention. Test is computer algorithm.
intervention.description: Diagnostic algorithms (test) will be run on already acquired clinical data. No study intervention in operator-prescribed clinical ablation. Predictive accuracy of test for study outcome will then be determined in follow-up

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing clinically prescribed ablation for complex atrial arrhythmias will be approached for enrollment. Most are anticipated to be atrial fibrillation or atrial tachyarrhythmias such as post-ablation flutter. Men and women over 21 years and up to 80 years of age will be included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing catheter ablation for atrial arrhythmias
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to sign informed consent
- Expected survival < 1 year
- Extreme comorbidity, such as advanced NYHA Class III/IV heart failure, dialysis, series stroke.
